document.docAuthor: Li, Hui-Min, Zhou, Wei & Song, Chun-Feng
document.docTitle: Sanicula orthacantha var. orthacantha var. orthacantha
document.masterDocTitle: Taxonomic studies on the genus Sanicula (Apiaceae) from China (): The clarification of some morphological distinction between S. orthacantha var. orthacantha and S. orthacantha var. brevispina, with the reduction of S. petagnioides to the synonymy of the former, and S. orthacantha var. stolonifera to

subSubSection.paragraph:
=
Sanicula petagnioides Hayata (1908: 103)
,
syn. nov.
Type :— CHINA , Taiwan , Mount Morrison (=Yu Shan), 7500 ped. (=
2286 m
),
15 October 1906
,
T. Kawakami & U. Mori 2026
(TAIF18726!, lectotype designated here; isolectotype TAIF18727!).
Remaining syntypes : same locality,
October 1906
,
G. Nakahara
s.n. (TI00013635!). Fig. 3.

Type :— CHINA , Yunnan , Mengtze (= Mengzi),
8000 ft
(=
2438 m
),
A. Henry 10500
[K000697284!, lectotype designated by Pimenov (2017) ; isolectotypes E00000049!, MO345421 !, NY00406257!, US00126973!]. Fig. 4
.

Type :— CHINA , Chongqing , Nanchuan , King Fu (=Jinfo Shan), Fong-feng-szu (= Fenghuang Temple),
2000 m
,
9 June 1935
,
K.L. Chu 1212
( holotype NAS00028652!; isotypes IBK00338581!, NAS00028653!, PE00754814!, PE00754815!, PE00754816!). Fig. 5A, B
.
Diagnostic characters :—Rhizome short, tuberlike, woody, oblique rootstock bearing elongated, fibrous roots, occasionally with fleshy stoloniferous.

Distribution and habitat :—
Sanicula orthacantha var. orthacantha
is widely distributed in China ( Anhui , Chongqing , Fujian , Gansu , Guangdong , Guangxi , Guizhou , Hubei , Hunan , Jiangxi , Shaanxi , Sichuan , Taiwan , Yunnan, Zhejiang), and Vietnam (Fig. 17). It grows on mountain slopes under forest or along ravine, stream at elevations of 600‒2140 m above sea level. It was recorded occur in Cambodia , India , Laos ( Sheh & Phillippe 2005 ), but we have not as yet seen any material from these countries.
Phenology :—Flowering and fruits from March to October.

Additional specimens examined :— CHINA . Anhui : Chizhou, Anonymous 17681 (NAS), Anonymous 78748 (NAS),

Ho 21439 (HZ); Jiangshan, L.C. Jin & J.K. You 3570 (ZM); Lishui, C.F. Song, Y.N. Xiong & L. Zhao LDS2781 (NAS), C.F. Song, Y.N. Xiong & L. Zhao LDS2871 (NAS), C.F. Song, Y.N. Xiong & L. Zhao LDS2904 (NAS); Pan’an, F.G. Zhang DPS955 (ZM); Suichang, Chang & Li 5164 (ZM), R.H. Shan 6267 (NAS), Zhejiang Plant Resour. Exped. 25663 (HZ, ZM).
VIETNAM . Lào Cai : Sa Pa, P.A. Pételot 3703 (L).

Lectotypification :—
Sanicula petagnioides
was described on the basis of three collections, namely T. Kawakami & U. Mori 1988 , T. Kawakami & U. Mori 2026 , and G. Nakahara s.n. We have been able to trace three specimens of later two collections at TAIF (Fig. 3) and TI. All these specimens match well the protologue and are syntypes as Hayata (1908) did not designated a type for
S. petagnioides
. According to ICN Art. 9.11 (
Turland et al. 2018
), here we designate T. Kawakami & U. Mori 2026 (TAIF18726; Fig. 3A), which is well preserved completely, as lectotype .

Notes :— In the protologue of
Sanicula henryi , Wolff (1913)
stated the collection
A. Henry 10500
was preserved in B. However , it has most likely been destroyed during World War II . Another five duplicates are kept at E, K, MO, NY and US , respectively, and all well preserved and also agree with the original description. Pimenov (2017) designated K sheet as its lectotype , and the sheets at E, MO, NY and US are isolectotypes. According to ICN Art. 9.3 (
Turland et al. 2018
), we accept the opinion of Pimenov (2017) .
